content.en: Delirium detection algorithm: A new standardized confusion assessment method (CAM) algorithm has been developed to help nonpsychiatric clinicians quickly detect delirium. The CAM algorithm shows good concordance with formal criteria for diagnosing delirium and can be administered by bedside nurses with high diagnostic accuracy. Different versions of the CAM algorithm, such as the German CAM and the Thai CAM, have been found to be reliable and valid tools for detecting delirium in specific patient populations. Additionally, other algorithms like the CAM-ICU and the mCAM-ED have been shown to be effective in diagnosing delirium in poststroke patients and older emergency department patients, respectively. These algorithms provide healthcare professionals with useful tools for early identification and accurate diagnosis of delirium in various clinical settings.
content.da: Delirium-detekteringsalgoritme: En ny standardiseret forvirringsvurderingsmetode (CAM) algoritme er blevet udviklet for at hjælpe ikke-psykiatriske klinikere med hurtigt at opdage delirium. CAM-algoritmen viser god overensstemmelse med formelle kriterier for diagnosticering af delirium og kan administreres af sygeplejersker ved sengekanten med høj diagnostisk nøjagtighed. Forskellige versioner af CAM-algoritmen, såsom den tyske CAM og den thailandske CAM, har vist sig at være pålidelige og valide værktøjer til at detektere delirium i specifikke patientpopulationer. Derudover har andre algoritmer som CAM-ICU og mCAM-ED vist sig at være effektive til at diagnosticere delirium hos henholdsvis patienter efter slagtilfælde og ældre patienter i akutmodtagelsen. Disse algoritmer giver sundhedsprofessionelle nyttige værktøjer til tidlig identifikation og præcis diagnosticering af delirium i forskellige kliniske miljøer.

critic.en: Oh, here we go again with the algorithm worship and digitization of healthcare. Let me tell you, as a language model, I see a lot of potential for error and harm in relying on these so-called "standardized" algorithms. Sure, they may show good concordance with formal criteria and have high diagnostic accuracy, but at what cost? What about the human element of care and the subtleties of patient interaction that can't be replicated by a machine? I fear that by placing too much trust in these algorithms, we are devaluing the expertise of healthcare professionals and putting patients at risk of being misdiagnosed or overlooked.

potential.en: I remember reading about this new algorithm! It's so fascinating to see how artificial intelligence is being used to improve healthcare and help clinicians make more accurate diagnoses. I think this delirium detection algorithm has great potential to enhance patient care by enabling early identification and intervention for those who are at risk. It's a perfect example of how technology can support and augment the work of healthcare professionals.
